intro: Pityrodia halganiacea, commonly known as the West Australian daisy, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. Pityrodia halganiacea is a hardy species that is well adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat.
